DefiningCitation: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders. 4th ed.
Tourette's syndrome.Definition: A neurological disorder characterized by repetitive, stereotyped, involuntary movements and vocalizations called tics. Both multiple motor and one or more vocal tics have been present at some time during the illness.  A tic is a sudden rapid recurrent, non rhythmic, stereotyped motor movement or vocalization.
